document_title: Rash on chest (breast): Causes, signs, treatment, prevention
subsection_name: phat-ban-o-nguc.json_8_How to prevent rashes on the chest (breasts)?
subsection_content:
Chest rashes are a sign of many different diseases and not all diseases can be completely prevented. This means it is very difficult to completely prevent breast rashes. However, we can reduce the risk of chest rashes if we do the following:
Maintaining good personal hygiene and keeping the breast area clean and dry will help reduce the risk of fungal infection.; Do not share towels or clothes with others; Actively avoid allergens; See your doctor if you have an unexplained rash on your chest despite following a scientific lifestyle.
A rash on the chest (breasts) is not dangerous if it is a symptom of a dermatological disease. On the contrary, this can also be a sign of breast cancer, so early examination and screening is needed.
